intro: Fagonia pakistanica, commonly known as the Kashmir spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan and northern India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or arid environments, and is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Fagonia pakistanica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
